data.title: Ireland Refuses to Extradite Man to US Because Prison System is Too Inhumane
American flag raised in Havana for first time in 54 years

Humans definitely killed off mammoths, giant armadillo, sabretooth tiger, scientists claim - New research settles argument about whether whether humans or climate change was responsible for the end of ‘megafauna’, it is claimed, and ‘debunks the myth of early humans living in harmony with nature’
South Korea's president pardons 6,500 criminals including CEOs convicted of embezzlement because of their "contributions to the national economy"

Police in Vietnam have seized more than 700 kilograms (1,500 pounds) of rhino horns and elephant tusks believed to have originated from Mozambique
Facebook cancelled a student's internship after he highlighted a massive privacy issue
Australia’s federal court rejects US studio’s claims for piracy damages, saying it may invoice downloaders for the cost of a legitimate copy only
US warns citizens not to attend Auckland TPP rally
25,000 Farmers Seek President’s Permission To Hang Themselves On Independence Day (Aug 15)
Norway’s government wants to dump 1,200 tons of radioactive waste on an island an hour south of Oslo, even though the waste company which owns the site believed it is too dangerous.
World Bank rejects energy industry notion that coal can cure poverty
Gene therapy cures blindness by replacing vision cells in eyes.
Air pollution in China is killing 4,000 people every day, a new study finds
Netanyahu appoints Danny Danon who opposes a Palestinian state and says that the Palestinian people don't exist as U.N. ambassador.
